meanings.definition: To make or become stronger or more resolute.
meanings.sent1: She decided to stouten her resolve and face her fears head-on.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise can help stouten your muscles and improve your overall health.
meanings.sent3: The knight drank a magical potion to stouten his courage before battling the dragon.
meanings.sent4: The support of her friends acted as a shield to stouten her determination in pursuing her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The wise words of her mentor served to stouten her belief in herself.

meanings.definition: To make or become more firm or solid.
meanings.sent1: Adding more flour will stouten the dough and make it easier to shape into bread.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers used extra cement to stouten the foundation of the building.
meanings.sent3: The chef needed to stouten the sauce by simmering it for a few more minutes.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between the two countries helped stouten the alliance during difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The bond between the siblings continued to stouten with each shared experience.
